result.execSummary:
The defendant Michele S Niedziejko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber.
Credit for 11 days, if revoked.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment, if deemed appropriate.

It is the Defendant's burden to petition the Court to receive the benefit of expunction. Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with her family and no contact with the businesses.
Provide DNA Sample if not already provided.

Case 16CM1959 was dismissed and read into 15CM1959 and 16CM328.

Restitution to be held open.
08/17/2016 RESTITUTION WAS DETERMINED. $58.00 FOR MUSIC TO GO AROUND AND $40.00 TO RECORD HEAD. Cash Bail applied, paid in full.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Michele S Niedziejko did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders that any bail that was previously applied to be reversed and be paid to the victims.
Restitution hearing on August 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.
